footer.text: Character Guide â€¢ Playstyle: Kinich | Update Date: 09/21/2024 | Editor: aqua.sh

description:
TLDR: Cast his skill and then normal attack until his bar is charged (usually two normal attacks), followed by casting skill again. Repeat until the end of his Nightsoul (skill) state. Make sure you are triggering the Burning or Burgeon reactions on enemies.

Kinich's main source of damage is through his skill which deals a large amount of AoE Dendro DMG. 

Once you cast his skill, he will grapple onto an enemy and start circling around this enemy and shooting when you Normal Attack. Doing this charges his Nightsoul bar and once it's full you can cast his skill again, firing a cannon that does a lot of damage. You can hold down the skill button to aim this cannon shot and target a different enemy or in between multiple enemies in order to deal damage to several enemies with one shot but do note this AoE isn't too large so you do want them grouped up.

After casting his large cannon shot, Kinich will create a little green area (blind spot) on a random side of the enemy, using your arrow keys and attacking to move into this area will charge his Nightsoul bar faster. Enemies affected by Burgeon or Burning DMG also greatly charge his skill through his A1 passive so make sure to do be utilizing either of those reactions.

In the event that this enemy dies or moves too far away, breaking Kinich's grappling hook, Normal Attacking again will connect him to the closest enemy in range.

Since Kinich's burst does not do much other than some damage, you do not need to build a lot of ER or worry too much about casting it. It can extend the duration of his skill to make up for the animation duration so you can use it during his skill if you need to.
title: Kinich | Playstyle
